frameDefinitions: A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.

An individual that is scheduled to be a Participant, or already is a Participant in an Activity or an Organization, indicates that  they will no not or no longer participate in that Activity or Organization.

An Initial_element is converted into a Final_element via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the Element.  '5.5 percent of nucleii decay from tritium to He3 in a year .'
An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.
A Cognizer thinks of and performs an Action that is a self- or other-imposed task or some other kind of desirable behavior.
frameExamples: Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
The Moslem contingent had <t>withdrawn</t> from the EC talks on May 27.
5.5 percent of nucleii <t>decay</t> from tritium to He3 in a year .
Mike <t>avoided</t> his supervisor at all costs.
Carolyn <t>abandoned</t> her car and jumped on a red double decker bus.
You invited everybody but you <t>forgot</t> Harry.
listRoleDefinitions: A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The individual or individuals that are engaged or are scheduled to be engaged in an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The event that the Participant is engaged in or was scheduled to be engaged in.
The <fen>Organization</fen> is an intentionally formed human social group with some definite structure to which the <fen>Participant</fen> belongs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Participant ends their participation in the Activity.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Participant ends the participation in the Activity.
A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.
The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location where the nuclear process occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> avoids an <fen>Undesirable_situation</fen>.
This role identifies the situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> avoids.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the avoiding occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the avoiding occurs.
The <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex> is the person who acts to leave behind the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fex name='Theme'>Theme</fex> is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex>'s possession.
When the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The person who thinks of or fails to think of an obligatory or desireable <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is supposed to carry out. This may be a Task imposed specifically on the <fen>Cognizer</fen> or it may be self- or socially imposed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is a person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> needs to affect or effect when carrying out the <fen>Action</fen>.
A <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers or fails to carry out an <fen>Action</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
Instead, <fex>he</fex> was challenged by Neil Gaudry, and withdrew from the race when it appeared that he would not be victorious.
In any event , in mid-April he withdrew <fex>from the contest</fex>.
This led to the decision to withdraw <fex>from IMF agreements</fex> in May 1987 .
<fex>Mike</fex> avoided his supervisor at all costs.
Mike avoided <fex>his supervisor</fex> at all costs.
.<fex>Alex and Zach Swindle</fex>, Centre, visited their brother in San Francisco in June and remembered to take along a copy of The Post>.
This time we remembered <fex>to turn the gas off before leaving</fex>.
We piled into the taxi and right when we were about to leave, I realized we forgot <fex>the video camera</fex>
He remembered <fex>afterwards</fex> to kiss her fingers.
